description: Erection of hip-to-gable and rear dormer roof extensions with installation of 2no front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: The proposed erection of hip-to-gable and rear dormer roof extensions with installation of 2no front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion falls within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Classes B & C of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The Council Highways Officer raise an objection to the submitted details for Condition 23 (Construction Management Plan) for the following reasons:To satisfy the subject condition, the applicant has submitted in addition to other documents, thefollowing supporting documents:Construction Phase Plan;Site Waste Management Plan; andTraffic Management PlanA review of the above listed documents indicated that the Applicant has addressed most of therequirements of Condition 23 with the exception of the underlisted items:- Non-inclusion of a site layout plan to show the location of all ancillary site buildings; Thedeveloper does describe the welfare facilities which will be made available on site however fails tomention the location of these facilities.- Non- provision of Wheel washing equipment.- Non-inclusion of tracking details for delivery vehicles- Old London Road is a dead end road where vehicles are required to turn around to leave thearea. The applicant has failed to provide information on how the turning around manoeuvre will beachieved without causing undue hindrance to neighbouring sites.- Non-inclusion of sizing and frequency of delivery vehicles expected on site- Non-inclusion of measures to protect Out of Order artwork adjacent to the site boundaryBased on the above, RBK Highways would object to the discharge of this application
